library.description: A library agnostic extensible DOM utility. Nothing else. Bonzo is designed to live in any host library, or simply as a stand-alone tool for the majority of your DOM-related tasks.
library.name: Bonzo

library.description: Build content declaratively or with nested JSON-ML style arrays, supporting DOM Element or HTML output for use in browsers or Node.js.
library.name: DOM-Builder

library.description: Gives a jQuery like interface in to using array, DOM and event functions in to the Closure Library
library.name: The G

library.description: A simple library that makes it easy to generate DOM nodes from a JSON-like structure.
library.name: DomBuilder

library.description: A library that provides addClass hasClass and removeClass to Elements and NodeLists with a simple wrapper.
library.name: Qlass.js

library.description:
Ellipsed is a JavaScript library for generating multi-lined ellipsed text. 
Indicating the number of visible lines, it will truncate the text at the correct position in targeted elements.
Where CSS can't go, this is the way to manipulate text on multiple lines.
library.name: Ellipsed

library.description: LiveFragment is a transparent container that allows manipulating a group of contiguous sibling DOM nodes as if they were in a real container node. It is kind of like DocumentFragment, except it manipulates nodes inside their actual parent node.
library.name: LiveFragment

library.description: A cross-browser JavaScript? range and selection library. It provides a simple standards-based API for performing common DOM Range and Selection tasks in all major browsers, abstracting away the wildly different implementations of this functionality between Internet Explorer up to and including version 8 and DOM-compliant browsers.
library.name: Rangy

library.description: The idea of DOMAssistant is to provide a simpler and more consistent way to script against the Document Object Model (DOM) in web browsers. The idea is that everything starts with the element(s) in question, selected through id or CSS selectors, and then perform various methods on it, such as adding or removing classes, events etc.
library.name: DOMAssistant
